hints_html: How do we relate information about inverses to determinants?

hints_raw: How do we relate information about inverses to determinants?
question: A 06
sols_html:
A requirement for a matrix to be invertible is that its determinant is non-zero. Conversely, non-invertible matrices have zero determinants. Therefore, if we compute the determinant of the matrix and force it to be zero, that will give a requirement on a. We can compute the determinant of the matrix by cofactor expansion (we will choose the first row),

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 0 & a\\ -1 & 1 & 1\\ 2 & 1 & 0 \end{vmatrix} =1 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1\\ 1 & 0 \end{vmatrix} +a \begin{vmatrix} -1 & 1\\ 2 & 1 \end{vmatrix} =-3a-1.\end{aligned}\]

We want this determinant to vanish and so we require -3a-1=0 or a=-1/3. Therefore, if a=-1/3 then the matrix will have a zero determinant and thus not be invertible.
sols_latex:
A requirement for a matrix to be invertible is that its determinant is
non-zero. Conversely, non-invertible matrices have zero determinants.
Therefore, if we compute the determinant of the matrix and force it to
be zero, that will give a requirement on \emph{a}. We can compute the
determinant of the matrix by cofactor expansion (we will choose the
first row),

\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix}
1  &  0  &  a\\
-1  &  1  &  1\\
2  &  1  &  0
\end{vmatrix}
=1
\begin{vmatrix}
1  &  1\\
1  &  0
\end{vmatrix}
+a
\begin{vmatrix}
-1  &  1\\
2  &  1
\end{vmatrix}
=-3a-1.
\end{align*}

We want this determinant to vanish and so we require -3\emph{a}-1=0 or
\emph{a}=-1/3. Therefore, if \emph{a}=-1/3 then the matrix will have a
zero determinant and thus \emph{not} be invertible.
statement_html:
For what values of the parameter a does the matrix

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & a\\ -1 & 1 & 1\\ 2 & 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

not have an inverse?
